department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Advanced Spanish Language I: Four Countries and their Cultures
course.meeting_text: Sections M. through Th., at 9, 10, 11, or 12
course.faculty_text: Johanna Damgaard Liander and members of the Department
course.description: An advanced language class that reinforces the practice of oral and written communication in Spanish through topics in contemporary cultural materials from Spain and Latin America. Students will focus on improving proficiency, refining pronunciation and acquiring vocabulary. In addition to in-class discussions, course work involves grammar review and practice in writing. Consult course website for current semester topics.
course.prerequisites: A score between 601-680 on the SAT II test or on the Harvard Placement Test, Spanish C, or permission of course head.
course.notes: Conducted in Spanish. May not be taken Pass/Fail but may be taken Sat/Unsat by GSAS students. Not open to auditors. Section on-line on the Spanish 30 website. Upon the recommendation of the course head, students who have performed at a superior level in this course may enroll in any course for which they are linguistically prepared.
